quizData.question: This component of TOGAF provides the "way of working" for architects.
What does CMMI stand for?
This is considered as the blueprint of an enterprise that provides a common organizational understanding
In MDA, this includes the business requirements and domain model that describes the state of the enterprise where the system will be integrated.
This pertains to a component of TOGAF that addresses the organization and processes required to establish and operate an architecture within an enterprise
This process involves the identification of the products and services that the business will sell, the target market, and the anticipated expenses.
What does TOGAF stand for?
choices: Control Objectives for Information and Related Technology

quizData.question: It is a framework in which different issues can be easily mapped to understand its nature, implications, and possible solutions.
What does ITIL stand for?
It refers to a collection of organizations that has a common set of goals, objectives, and/or a single targeted outcome
This is considered as the key feature of MDA
It originated as a generic framework and methodology for developing technical architectures.
What was the Zachman framework formerly called?
In CMMI, this phase involves processes that are planned, performed, and measured
